Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision rejecting the refugee claim due to lack of risk and adequate state protection was reasonable
Application_Facts: Mr. Ali claimed persecution by sectarian extremists and insufficient state protection in Pakistan
Decision_Outcome: The Board's decision was not patently unreasonable
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution by sectarian extremists, inadequate state protection
Assessment_Factor: Risk profile, adequacy of state protection
Evidence_Used: Evidence of state efforts to curb sectarian violence in Pakistan
Evidence_Assessed: State protection measures, individual risk profile
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Board's rejection decision
Governing_Rule: Decisions of the Refugee Protection Division are reviewed for patent unreasonableness
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution due to sectarian violence
Cause_Description: Mr. Ali claimed persecution by sectarian extremists and insufficient state protection in Pakistan
Evidence_Handling: Board considered evidence on state protection and individual risk
Evidence_Assessment: Board assessed evidence of state protection and lack of high-risk profile
Decision_Rationale: Lack of high-risk profile and existence of state protection efforts
